answers.answer: A variety of conditions can lead to the symptoms.  Metabolic disturbances like changes in the calcium, potassium or sodium levels should be checked, as well a thyroid function and diabetes.Peripheral neuropathy can be evaluated with appropriate neurologic tests like an EMG and nerve conduction studies.More central neurologic causes can be evaluated with a spinal MRI.I would suggest a neurology referral at this point to further discuss these options.These questions should be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patients education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com
